Description: Body fragment of Ionian Middle Wild Goat II pottery krater (?); interior: streaky brown glaze; exterior: cream slip: glazed area above part of a wild goat grazing to right with large pendant triangle above; filling ornament: quartered lozenge with dots, cross with dots; purple patch on neck of wild goat. Reddish-brown clay with a fair amount of silver mica.
Producer name: Made by: The London Dinos Group
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare Price 1924, pp. 193-195, figs. 20-22 (possibly from the same workshop).
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.959)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
